channel.title: Looking for a light weight Linux OS to run Axo Gui
channel.description: Hi all, I have an old laptop with Vista that struggles to run the Axo Gui I expect because of the resource sapping Vista itself. So I am thinking about replacing Vista with a Linux OS instead. I have no experience with Linux OS's, but more than happy to do the learning, but could I please ask for suggestions of Linux OS's that are light weight on resources but will still run Axo Gui efficiently, and would also be not to difficult for a first timer on Linux. Thanks all..

item.title: Looking for a light weight Linux OS to run Axo Gui
item.dc:creator: @Gavin Gavin
item.description:
@Gavin wrote:

Hooray ! installed Mint XFCE and so far so good.
next step to instal axo gui

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for a light weight Linux OS to run Axo Gui

item.title: Looking for a light weight Linux OS to run Axo Gui
item.dc:creator: @mongrol
item.description:
@mongrol wrote:

If you have no experience I recommend Linux Mint XFCE edition. It's very newbie friendly and light on resources. The UI is also similar to Windows. Mint is based on Ubuntu which is also recommended in it's XFCE edition. (XFCE is a Desktop GUI which is made to be lightweight).

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for a light weight Linux OS to run Axo Gui
